verses.verse: Then it came about as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat food on the Sabbath that they watched him closely.
And behold, a certain man was before him whose body was swollen with fluid.
Jesus responded saying to the lawyers and Pharisees, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?"
They were kept quick, but he took [him], healed him, and let him go.
Then he answered them saying, "Which of you will have a donkey or ox fall into a pit and will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath?"
They could not contradict these things.
He then told a parable to those who were invited, when he saw how they chose the most honored seats, saying to them,
"When you are invited by any one to a wedding, don't sit down on the most honored chair, lest a more honored man than you is invited by him.
"He who invited you and him comes to you and says, «Give this man this place,» and you in shame start to take the lowest place.

"Instead, when you are invited, go and sit down in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may say to you, «Friend, take a more honorable place.» Then you will have the honor in the presence of those who sit at dinner with you.
"For whosoever exalts himself will be abased, and he who humbles himself will be exalted."

Then he also said to him who invited him, "When you make a dinner or supper, don't call your friends, your brethren, nor your relatives or your rich neighbors, lest they also invite you in return and pay you back.
"Instead when you make a feast invite the poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind.
"You will be blessed, because they cannot repay you, and you will be repaid at the resurrection of the just."
When one of those who sat at the dinner with him heard these things, he said to him, "Blessed is he who will eat bread in the Kingdom of God!"
Then he said to them, "A certain man made a great supper and invited many.
He sent his servant at supper time to say to those who were invited, «Come, for all things are now ready.»
"And they all started to make the some excuse. The first said to him, «I have bought some land, and I have to go and see it. I ask you to have me excused.»
"Another said, «I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to test them. I ask you to have me excused.»
"Another said, «I have gotten a wife, and that's why I cannot come.»

"So that servant came and reported to his lord these things. Then the master of the house getting angry said to his servant, «Quickly go out into the streets and avenues of the city. Bring in here the poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind.
"The servant said, «Lord, it is done as you have commanded, and still there is room.»
"Then the lord said to the servant, «Go out into the highways and fence rows and persuade them to come in, so that my house will be filled.»
"For I say to you: Not one of those men who were invited will taste of my supper."
And there went great multitudes with him, and he turned around to them and said,
"If anyone comes to me and doesn't hate his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, sisters, and yes even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
"Whosoever doesn't bear his cross and follow me, cannot be my disciples.
"For which of you intending to build a tower, doesn't sit down first and calculate the cost, to know if he has enough to finish?
"Lest after he has laid the foundation and not able to finish it, everyone that looks at it will start making fun of him,
saying, «This man started to build and wasn't able to finish.»
"Or what king, going to wage war against another king, doesn't sit down first and consult where he is able with a thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
"Otherwise while the other is still far away, he sends ambassadors and desires conditions of peace.
"So likewise whosoever among you that doesn't forsake everything, he cannot be my disciples.
"Salt is good, but if the salt has become tasteless, how can it season things?
"It is neither fit for the land or for the dung hill, but men throw it out. He that has ears to hear, must hear."
